info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN ERIE... WYOMING...GENESEE...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 826 AM EST, the northern edge of the strong lake effect snow band was from Lackawanna and Blasdell to West Seneca, Elma and Darien. The band was impacting areas as far south as North Collins, Strykersville and Attica. The band was beginning to lift north across southern portions of the Buffalo Metro. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Lackawanna, Depew, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Darien Lakes State Park, Evans, Elma, Eden, Marilla, Bennington, Orchard Park, Small Boat Harbor, Alden, Blasdell, Attica, and Angola. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 52A and 57A. SAFETY INFO... The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
